result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew A Atkinson

records.addlTxt:
10:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew A Atkinson not in court.  Attorney Gavin Grubofski in court for Matthew A Atkinson. 
Court issues warrant for non appearance - body only.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel
Motion and prop. order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
This bond modification does not start until March 3rd 2022, when the defendant is able to get into the treatment facility. 
Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. No controlled substances without a valid prescription. Must go to the treatment facility in Fond Du Lac and successfully complete the program. Once defendant is finished with treatment, he must report back to jail immediately.

This bond modification does not start until March 3rd 2022, when the defendant is able to get into the treatment facility. 
Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. No controlled substances without a valid prescription. Must go to the treatment facility in Fond Du Lac and successfully complete the program. Once defendant is finished with treatment, he must report back to jail immediately.

09:14 AM Defendant Matthew A Atkinson in court with attorney Greg Venturini.  Defendant Matthew A Atkinson in custody in the Waupaca County Jail.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matthew A Atkinson appeared by video means with Attorney. Attorney Venturini appears in court by telephone. 
Attorney Venturini informs the court that the defendant was accepted into treatment and believes the parties have came to an agreement to modify bond to allow the defendant to go into treatment.
Attorney Lambert makes a statement to the court regarding the modification of bond for treatment.
Court modifies the cash bonds into signature bonds for the same amount starting on March 3rd when he can start treatment. He must go straight to the treatment facility in Fond Du Lac and successfully complete the program. As long as he completes treatment, court will give the defendant day for day credit. As soon as the defendant is done with treatment he must report back to jail immediately.
Bail/bond hearing on March 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
